title: Edge of Context: Tips and Tricks in Machine Learning

items.title: LoRAX Playbook - Orchestrating Thousands of LoRA Adapters on Kubernetes
items.content_html: A hands-on guide for serving many fine-tuned adapters on one GPU with LoRAX, from architecture insights to Kubernetes deployments and API usage.

items.title: Domain-driven design for AI agents: a beginner-friendly guide
items.content_html: Learn how domain-driven design (DDD) keeps AI agents aligned with the business domain, with practical patterns, code snippets, and tooling tips.

items.title: Context Engineering in the Agentic‑AI Era — and How to Cook It
items.content_html: A practical guide to designing, evaluating, and shipping the context layer (a.k.a. context engineering) for agentic AI systems — with diagrams, patterns, and a starter config.

items.title: Building a Custom FeatureStoreLite MCP Server Using uv
items.content_html: A step-by-step guide that shows how to create your own lightweight feature store MCP server from scratch using FastMCP, run it through **uv**, and integrate it with Claude Desktop. This is a practical example of building a useful MCP server that ML engineers can actually use.

items.title: Choosing the Right Open-Source LLM Variant & File Format
items.content_html: A practical guide to navigating open-source LLM variants and file formats, covering model types (Base, Instruct, Distill, QAT, MoE), quantization formats (GGUF, GPTQ, AWQ), and hardware-specific recommendations for optimal performance.

items.title: Quick-guide on Local Stable-Diffusion Toolkits for macOS
items.content_html: Compare five Stable Diffusion interfaces for macOS - from one-click DiffusionBee to node-based ComfyUI. Find your perfect match based on ease of use, features, and Apple Silicon performance.

items.title: Quick-guide on Running LLMs Locally on macOS
items.content_html: A comparison of the top 5 local LLM toolchains for macOS, helping you choose the right solution for your needs.

items.title: Quick-Guide on `pyproject.toml`
items.content_html: A practical, modern guide to using pyproject.toml for Python projects—covering packaging, dependencies, tool configuration, and workflows in one file.

items.title: Quick-Guide on ~/.zprofile vs ~/.zshrc 🚀
items.content_html: A clear guide explaining when zsh loads ~/.zprofile vs ~/.zshrc, what belongs in each file, and how to keep your shell configuration clean and maintainable.

items.title: MLOps in the Age of Foundation Models. Evolving Infrastructure for LLMs and Beyond
items.content_html: An exploration of how ML infrastructure and MLOps practices have evolved in response to the rise of large-scale foundation models, contrasting classic MLOps with modern paradigms and highlighting key changes, patterns, and tools.

items.title: Scaling Large Language Models - Practical Multi-GPU and Multi-Node Strategies for 2025
items.content_html: A practical guide to scaling large language models across multiple GPUs and nodes, with real-world strategies from Hugging Face's Ultra-Scale Playbook.

items.title: Quick-Guide on setting up a MacBook for AI Engineering
items.content_html: A 10-step guide to configuring a new MacBook for AI development, covering essential tools and terminal setup.

items.title: Quick Guide: Managing Python on macOS with uv
items.content_html: Lightning-fast Python installs with Rust-powered uv.
